ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I further developed the skills to speak and read Russian at a more advanced level.
Deep understanding of the Russian Language
I gained a lot more confidence in the different cases in Russian as well as improving pronunciation.

By the end of the second semester, we finished learning all of the six Russian grammatical cases, past and future tenses, perfective and imperfective aspects, etc. It truly feels like we have learned the basics of the Russian language!
We followed the skills outlined in the textbook, which included all cases of the Russian language, idiomatic expressions, etc.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class was very well taught, and the only weakness that could be critiqued is the weeks when both quizzes and tests were only days apart. It was hard to get enough time to study/completely absorb the new material.
The intimate setting of a small class was crucial to learning the Russian language. Amazing teachers and amazing community.
I thought the course had a great structure, with regular tests/quizzes/homework that provided consistent feedback. Some weeks, however, the work would pile up if we got off sequence.
The course is very structured with clear deadlines and you always know where you are with the course material.

I wish the course were less video-based and textbook-based. Sometimes the schedule was crunched together with three assessments in a week, so I really wish it has been planned better at the beginning of the semester, as those busy weeks also had other assignments for other classes as well, which, frankly, made them almost unbearable.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Professor Titus and the TFs are great!
Yes, I would recommend this class because you really develop a good tool set for speaking and reading Russian. You also learn about Russian culture.
Absolutely. This class will provide an amazing foundation for Russian.
It is a fantastic language to take at Yale! It may seem intimidating; however, the class was fun and supportive!

Yes, I would recommend this course. Russian may not be one of the most popular languages, but it is very valuable if you are interested in international affairs, economics, etc. It is a tough language to learn but very worth it.
I would recommend this course to another student only if they are passionate and certain about Russian.
